1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

2.text: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?

3.text: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches with which he can do no good?

4.text: Yes, you cast off fear, and restrain prayer before God.

5.text: For your mouth utters your iniquity, and you choose the tongue of the crafty.

6.text: Your own mouth comdemns you, and not I: yes, your own lips testify against you.

7.text: Are you the first man that was born? or were you made before the hills?

8.text: Have you heard the secret of God? and do you restrain wisdom to yourself?

9.text: What know you, that we know not? what understand you, which is not in us?

10.text: With us are both the gray headed and very aged men, much elder than your father.

11.text: Are the consolations of God small with you? is there any secret thing with you?

12.text: Why does your heart carry you away? and what do your eyes wink at,

13.text: That you turn your spirit against God, and let such words go out of your mouth?

14.text: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

15.text: Behold, he puts no trust in his saints; yes, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

16.text: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinks iniquity like water?

17.text: I will show you, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

18.text: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

19.text: To whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

20.text: The wicked man travails with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

21.text: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come on him.

22.text: He believes not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

23.text: He wanders abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knows that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

24.text: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

25.text: For he stretches out his hand against God, and strengthens himself against the Almighty.

26.text: He runs on him, even on his neck, on the thick bosses of his bucklers:

27.text: Because he covers his face with his fatness, and makes bulges of fat on his flanks.

28.text: And he dwells in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabits, which are ready to become heaps.

29.text: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof on the earth.

30.text: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

31.text: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompense.

32.text: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.

33.text: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

34.text: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

35.text: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepares deceit.
